member.summary: Defines the interface required for a class to be used as a checker engine
member.remarks: This is the interface which any checker engine must have, by implementing this interface any object can be used to parse text and identify 'bad words'. It is not necessary to functionally implement all members, for this reason an abstract empty implementation class is provided (CheckerEngineAdapter) which can be extended and overridden for desired functionality.

member.name: T:Infragistics.SpellChecker.SpellChecker
member.summary: Spell checker engine, checks a text string for spelling errors and makes suggested corrections.
member.remarks:
This is a non-GUI component, suitable for the business/logic layer of your application. You would use this component in web server based applications. This component can be used in 2 different ways. The most common usage, in an iterative fashion is detailed below, but it may also be used on a query by query basis. To use this component in an iterative way you must first call Check to set the text to check and then iterate through NextBadWord() to identify misspelt words. NextBadWord will return a BadWord object and internally locate the the misspelt word in the text, then you can call FindSuggestions which will return a ArrayList of suggestions as String objects. You may also call ChangeBadWord(replacement) to replace that current misspelt word in the text. NextBadWord() will return null when the text has been checked. GetAmendedText returns the current state of the text with corrections.
Calling ChangeBadWord or FindSuggestions before NextBadWord has been called and returned a BadWord (i.e. not null) will result in a .

remarks.para: The second way to use this component is simply to query words yourself using Lookup(word) to check if word is in the lexicon/dictionary and FindSuggestions(word) to find spelling suggestions for word.

member.name: M:Infragistics.SpellChecker.SpellChecker.FindCompoundWords(System.String,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Finds the compound words in the text and puts them in subwords. Set subwords to null/nothing to just find if the text has a compound word formation.
member.remarks:
Only adds words to the list if all are valid. In other words, this will not find all words that are part of the text, but only the words that all make up the text.
E.g. "catchmentarea" has words "catchment" and "area" but not "cat", "me" etc. The order of the words in the list is the reverse of their order in the text.
member.param: The text to find compound words in
A list that formative sub-words will be added to, can be null/nothing.
member.returns: True if the text is entirely formed from compound words, False if not.

member.name: M:Infragistics.SpellChecker.SpellChecker.FindSplitWords(System.String,System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Finds correctly spelled words in the text and puts them in subwords. Set subwords to null/nothing to just find if the text has compound word formation.
member.remarks:
Only adds words to the list if all are valid. In other words, this will not find all words that are part of the text, but only the words that all make up the text.
E.g. "catchmentarea" has words "catchment" and "area" but not "cat", "me" etc. The order of the words in the list is the reverse of their order in the text.
member.param: The text to find compound words in
A list that formative sub-words will be added to, can be null/nothing.
member.returns: True if the text is entirely formed from compound words, False if not.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.PerformanceOptions
member.summary: Class which contains the options which influence to performance of spelling

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.PerformanceOptions.AllowCapitalizedWords
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to Allow words with all capital letters.
member.remarks: Performance increases marginally if set to true. When set to "True" words that only have capitalized letters are ignored. When set to "False", words with all capitalized letters will be treated as a normal word.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.PerformanceOptions.CheckCompoundWords
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to check for compound words.

remarks.p: Setting this to true is essential for languages such as German which allow for compound words. For example: if the word is "thesewordsarejoined" when the property is set to "False" the word would be marked as misspelled. But when set to "True" the word would be marked as spelled correctly. However, if one of the words inside of the compound word was misspelled, the whole word would be marked as misspelled.
Setting this to true will degrade lookup performance by a maximum of approximately 100[1-1/n] percent (where n is the number of letters in the word) for misspelt words.
There is no performance degredation for correctly spelt words.
On average for texts with mostly correctly spelt words the performance degredation for the Check method is roughly 25%.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.PerformanceOptions.ConsiderationRange
member.summary: Gets/Sets the factor for how close words need to be to be suggested.
member.remarks: The size factor for words to consider for suggestions. Lower values are faster but consider less words for suggestions. When the property is set to a value less than 0 it will default to 80.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.PerformanceOptions.SplitWordThreshold
member.summary: The value of the property determines the minimum size of each word in order for it to become a suggestion.
member.remarks: The property coincides with SuggestSplitWords. The value of the property determines the minimum size of each word in order for it to become a suggestion. For example, "myhouse" has two words, "my" and "house." In order for "my house" to be a suggestion, the SplitWordThreshold must be set to 2 or less. A lower threshold results in worse performance. ///

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.PerformanceOptions.SuggestSplitWords
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to look for connected words in suggestions.
member.remarks: When set to "True" suggestions may include joined words. For example: if the misspelled word was "helloworld," suggestions would include "hello world." Note: when turned on there will be a slight hit in performance. ///

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.CheckHyphenatedText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to 'look into' text with hyphens (-), if the word has hyphens in it and CheckHyphenatedText is set true (default), the parts of the text around the hyphens will be checked individually.
member.remarks: E.g. "socio-economic" will be checked as "socio" and "economic".

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.ConsiderationRange
member.summary: Gets/Sets the factor for how close words need to be to be suggested.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.IncludeUserDictionaryInSuggestions
member.summary: Gets/Sets a value indicating whether the user dictionary should be used in finding suggestions for misspelt words.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.LanguageParser
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of language parsing to use.
member.remarks: E.g. If the dictionary is set to French, you should use the French parser.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.SeparateHyphenWords
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to separate words with hyphens in them into separate words.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.SplitWordThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum size of each word in order for it to become a suggestion. For example, "myhouse" has two words "my" and "house" in order for "my house" to be a suggestion, the SplitWordThreshold must be set to 2 or smaller. A lower threshold results in worse performance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.SuggestionsMethod
member.summary: Gets/Sets the suggestions should be done using hashing or phonetically.

member.name: P:Infragistics.SpellCheckerWrapper.SuggestSplitWords
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to look for connected words in suggestions.
member.remarks:
if this=true then suggestions may include joined words.
Eg; suggestions for "myhouse" will include "my house"

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions
member.summary: The class lists properties which determine how the spell check operation will proceed and react to issues found in the text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.AllowAnyCase
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to allow words spelt with any case, e.g. "africa" instead of "Africa." This is more relaxed than AllowMixedCase.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.AllowCaseInsensitiveSuggestions
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to allow suggestions for correctly spelled words with mixed case.
member.remarks: For example: if AllowMixedCase is false and the word "tHE" is passed to the WebSpellChecker, when set to "True" you will recieve suggestions, when set to "False" you will not.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.AllowMixedCase
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to allow words spelt with mixed case, e.g. "MIxEd."

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.AllowWordsWithDigits
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to Allow words with numbers in them (eg. A10 or 7-11).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.AllowXml
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to Allow XML/HTML tags, false by default.
member.remarks: This identifies XML tags as anything in between < and > characters. Therefore it will cause undesirable effects in text such as " the sign for less than is < and the sign for greater than is > ". Of course in HTML that should have been written as " the sign for less than is < and the sign for greater than is > "; anyway, which would be fine.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.CheckHyphenatedText
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to check text with hyphenate.
member.remarks: When set to "True" the hyphenated text is checked as separate words. When set to "False" the hyphenated text is checked as one word. If that word is in the dictionary it will be marked as correct. True: The word "after-effect" would be treated as "after" and "effect". False: The word "after-effect" would be treated as "after-effect". For both "true" and "false", if misspelled the whole word will be marked as misspelled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.IncludeUserDictionaryInSuggestions
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether the user dictionary should be used in finding suggestions for misspelt words.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.LanguageParser
member.summary: Gets/Sets the language parser to use.
member.remarks: This should match the language of the main dictionary where possible. This is used to give hints to the parser about how punctuation is used (e.g. apostrophe is used differently in English and French).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.SeparateHyphenWords
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether the hyphenated text is treated as separate words.
member.remarks: When set to "True" the hyphenated text is treated as separate words. For e.g. if this is true text like "cheap-deals" will be treated as two words "cheap" and "deals". If one of the words was misspelled only that word would be marked as misspelled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Interactions.SpellOptions.SuggestionsMethod
member.summary: Gets/Sets the method by which suggestions are determined.

member.summary: Cancels a pending asynchronous operation.

For example, if you call CancelAsyncDictionaryDownload to cancel a operation and you have specified an event handler for the event, your event handler receives notification that the operation has ended. To learn whether the operation completed successfully, check the Cancelled property of the for the relevant completed event handler.
